entry.title: Evolution of Data and Analytics with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction to Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud was introduced on February 13 2025 as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution fully managed by SAP. SAP Business Data Cloud is a data & analytics platform that harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources into a unified semantic layer of trusted data that governs, connects and share data securely across systems or cloud. By integrating powerful functionality of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Databricks and SAP Business Warehouse. It empowers businesses to break data silos to power advanced AI and analytics.

Why was Business data cloud introduced?

  • To get easier access to SAP data without the need for complex data preparation steps such as extraction, building semantics, transformation and loading data for analytics.
  • To get access to all SAP data from all Line of Business (LoB) applications, such as SAP S/4HANA, SAP SuccessFactors and SAP Ariba without the need of 3rd party connector & tool.
  • To get a unified business view of the data regardless of which SAP application it originated from without making harmonization difficult and holds its original business context without any change.
  • To accelerate AI with trusted and secure data that they can use to build reliable AI applications to accelerate innovation and insights with AI.
  • To get faster access to SAP data insights by removing data preparation and dashboard building steps.
  • To get a Simplified Landscape by reducing multiple tools, silos and complex tasks of manual data preparation, development and analytics.

Key Features & Capabilities of Business Data Cloud: 

SAP Business Data Cloud Key Innovation of out-of-the-box components

  • Intelligent Applications: Intelligent Applications are predefined, SAP-managed dashboards for analytics based on underlying Data Products and models.
  • Data Products: Create and share governed, reusable data products that deliver consistent, high-quality business information across teams and systems.
  • BDC Cockpit: Centrally manage your data products, monitor usage, and enforce governance policies, all from one intuitive interface.

SAP Business Data Cloud Integrated Software components:

  • SAP Datasphere: to provide the data integration and modelling.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud: to provide the analysis and planning.
  • SAP Databricks: to provide AI and machine learning enhancements.
  • SAP BW/BW4HANA: can be used as a data source for datasphere & databricks.

SAP Business Data Cloud is built on SAP Business Technology Platform:

  • Unified Customer Landscape used to connect the SAP Business Data Cloud components.
  • SAP HANA Cloud provides the data storage layer.
  • SAP Security and Compliance to manage access and permissions and governs regulatory compliance.
  • SAP Development & Integration to provide developer tools for modelling & data Integration
  • SAP AI & Analytics to provide advanced analytics and AI powered insights.

SAP Business Data Cloud Architecture:

  • Source System layer: It harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources, into a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced analytics and to build AI applications.
  • Foundation Service Layer: This layer replicates and harmonizes data from the source systems to produce curated, governed Data Products that retain their original business context. Data products are grouped by Data Packages to make it easy to discover them and to activate them. This data is stored in a hyper scaler environment using SAP HANA Cloud and Data Lake files.
  • Business Data Fabric Layer: It combines the strengths of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), and SAP Business Warehouse (BW) capabilities, enhanced by the Databricks platform to unify an organization with SAP and Non â€“ SAP and third-party data into a single, trusted foundation model.
  • SAP Datasphere is the technological foundation for the business data fabric within BDC. It integrates, transforms, and enriches data from SAP and non-SAP sources into powerful semantic models. Data can be replicated into Datasphere for faster performance or accessed virtually from its source, allowing for flexible management of a hybrid data landscape.
  • SAP Databricks is an Advanced AI and machine learning technology. It provides a pro-code environment for data engineers and AI developers to build, train, and deploy custom AI and ML models using the rich, semantically aware data from SAP applications.
  • SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA: For customers with existing on-premises SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA systems, this component provides a modernization path within the Business Data Fabric. A Data Product Generator can be used to convert BW Info Provider data into cloud-ready data products, which can then be consumed by Datasphere for analytics or by Databricks for AI/ML.
  • SAP Business Data Cockpit: SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit allows you to browse and find pre delivered Intelligent Applications and data products, install Intelligent Applications, and share data products with SAP Datasphere & Databricks to enable analytics & enrich with AI and machine learning capabilities.
  • Intelligent Application Layer: Itâ€™s a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced AI & Analytics.
  • SAP Analytical Cloud: Using SAP Analytics Cloud, business users can run ad-hoc analysis, explore the provided data with AI-driven chat capabilities, or act on their insights with AI-driven suggestions, bridging the gap between analytics and their end-to-end business processes.
  • Intelligent Application: SAP Business Data Cloud Intelligent Applications are used to provide the required dashboard in out-of-the-box reporting scenarios with its advanced visualization and planning functions
  • Joule: Joule uses natural language processing to interact, access insights, and perform tasks across SAP and third-party applications. It uses "agents" and "skills" to automate multi-step workflows and provide contextual assistance.

How SAP Business Data Cloud work as one domain model:

Scenario 1: Out-of-the-Box model with Datasphere

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

 Scenario 2:  AI and machine learning enhancement by Databricks

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

Step 6: Integration of SAP Databricks

It is possible to extend the results shown in the dashboard with machine learning and AI based Insights, to do so use the SAP business data cockpit to share data product with databricks,

In SAP Databricks AI and Machine learning techniques are used to generate the desired result, this results then shared back to the data model and extend your dashboard with AI and Machine learning insights.

Scenario 2:  : Integration of SAP BW & SAP Analytical Cloud

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP BDC cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: This is where the integration of your third-party data comes into play. The advanced integration and data modelling capabilities of SAP Datasphere allow you to integrate your third-party data into the out-of-the-box data model.

Step 6: Integration of SAP BW

It is also possible to integrate your existing objects from SAP BW/4HANA into SAP Business Data Cloud. With a dedicated data provisioning tool, you can onboard your SAP BW objects into SAP Datasphere and combine them with the existing data model.

Step 7: Integration of SAP Analytical Cloud 

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a wide range of consumption options on top of your data model. Use the AI-based Just Ask feature in SAP Analytics Cloud. The power of its natural language processing allows you to request information from your data model simply by typing a question about your data. Answers are instantly displayed in the most appropriate format.

Role of Source system & Data product in BDC:

Role of Datasphere in BDC:

 Role of Databricks in BDC:

 Role of BW in BDC:

 Role of SAC in BDC:

 Role of Intelligent Application Dashboard & Joule in BDC:

 
Use Case of Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud can handle many use-cases including:

  • Data Integration & Modelling 
  • Data Governance and Compliance 
  • Development of AI and machine learning models
  • Data Warehousing
  • Planning and BI 
  • Development of intelligent applications to support all business processes.
  • End-to-end data lifecycle management by SAP 

SAP Business Data Cloud reaches all personas of the organization.

Conclusion: 

Data from all SAP applications is combined and made available to the businesses under a single domain model. With SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP has reached the next level of data and analytics evolution to tackle challenges and enables businesses to seamlessly integrate, harmonize, and analyse data from multiple sources, transforming raw data into valuable insights with advanced AI and analytics. 

By adopting the latest 2025 features, organizations can accelerate analytics, improve decision-making, and prepare for AI-driven innovation.

Reference:

Learning Journey: https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/exploring-sap-business-data-cloud
Live Session : https://learning.sap.com/live-sessions/overview-of-sap-business-data-cloud
SAP Help Document : https://help.sap.com/docs/business-data-cloud
GenAI Assistance : Assistance in drafting the structure of blog.

entry.title: Partner Get Certified Academy for SAP BTP Administrator
entry.content:
Ready to take your SAP BTP expertise to the next level?

Join the Partner Get Certified Academy for SAP BTP Administrator â€” designed exclusively for SAP Partners who want to strengthen their hands-on skills and prepare for the SAP Certified â€“ SAP BTP Administrator exam.

Guided by SAP experts, youâ€™ll explore key topics including architecture setup, platform connectivity, identity services, DevOps tools, Terraform configuration, and observability strategies.

By the end, youâ€™ll be equipped with the insights and confidence to take on the certification and advance your SAP BTP journey.

ğŸ‘‰ Register here https://partneredge.sap.com/en/library/education/psd/2025/nov/e_oe_te_w_PSD_WEB_00011998.html

#SAP #SAPBTP #SAPPartners #SAPTraining #BTPAdministrator #SAPCertification

entry.title: Ready to master administrating SAP Business Technology Platform?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Administrating SAP Business Technology Platform  learning journey. 

Learning outcome

  • Set up and operate an SAP BTP architecture
  • Utilize SAP BTP platform connectivity and Cloud Connector
  • Manage SAP BTP users and authorizations
  • Set up and operate SAP Cloud Identity Services
  • Explain the Observability Strategy of SAP BTP
  • Utilize the DevOps cloud services offered by SAP BTP
  • Manage agile software development projects on SAP BTP
  • Set up and operate configuration tools
  • Manage an SAP BTP infrastructure with Terraform
  • Review the cost and consumption of SAP BTP accounts 
 

Goals

  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics
  • Develop your expertise: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning

Prerequisites

  • Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Where can I learn how to use SAP BTP for architecture design and IT strategy alignment?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Becoming an SAP BTP Solution Architect  learning journey.

Upon completing this learning journey, you will have a comprehensive understanding of the tools and methods required to effectively use SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to envision and design an enterprise architecture. In your role as a solution architect, you will be equipped with the skills to align IT strategies with business objectives using SAP BTP tools and technologies. Additionally, you will gain the ability to estimate the costs of various use-cases, ensuring that your solutions are both effective and cost-efficient.


Goals
  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics
  • Develop your expertise: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning

Prerequisites

  • Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform
 

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Building a Generative AI-powered Inventory Assistant with SAP CAP, RAG, and Vector Database
entry.content:
Introduction

In modern enterprises, inventory management is no longer just about tracking numbers â€” it's about accessing the right information at the right time and enabling fast, data-driven decisions. Today, Generative AI offers a powerful opportunity to make these processes smarter, faster, and more intuitive.

In this project, I transformed a stock management application built with SAP CAP (Node.js) on SAP BTP into an intelligent decision assistant by integrating Generative AI, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) , and a vector database .

The application interprets natural language queries, finds relevant products using embedding-based similarity search , retrieves real records from the database, and â€” thanks to the grounding approach â€” generates responses strictly based on actual data. This prevents hallucinations and ensures a trusted enterprise AI experience.

A key learning resource for this development was the SAP Learning Journey
â€œSolving Business Problems using SAP's Generative AI Hubâ€
which helped me explore and apply Generative AI concepts in real SAP BTP scenarios.

In this blog, I will walk through the architecture, implementation details, and the technical components behind this solution.

 

STEP 1:

We set up the Basic CAP file structure  with "cds init" in the terminal 

 

  • Creates package.json and config files

  • Prepares db, srv, app folders

And then .envwe define our Gemini API key in the file in the project root directory.

 

Then we create the "serice.cds and service.js" files under the "SRV" folder.

and we define "service.cds" as follows:

namespace ai;

using data from '../db/products';


type ChatTurn {
  role   : String;  
  content: String;
}

type ChatResponse {
  content : String;
}


service ProductService @(path:'/products') {
  entity Products as projection on data.Products;

}

service AIService @(path:'/ai') {
  : { method: 'POST', path: 'chat' }
  action chat(message: String, history: many ChatTurn) returns ChatResponse;

 
}

  • ChatTurn: Represents each line of conversation (role: user/assistant, content: message)

  • ChatResponse: Response format returned from chat (an object containing only content)

These structures are used for AI chat API .

 

And right below, we define a "product" service that exposes product data to the outside.

This section 

  • /productsvia endpoint

  • data.Productsshows his painting to the outside world

Just below this, we define the AI â€‹â€‹service .
This service is the structure that responds to user requests sent in natural language.

We created an action inside the service chatcalled . In the CAP world, action is used to execute special business logic outside of classic CRUD operations (CREATE/READ/UPDATE/DELETE).

This chataction:

  • message: text written by the user,

  • history: previous conversation history

takes and

  • ChatResponse: that is, the answer generated by artificial intelligence

returns.

In short, this action is the bridge between the UI side and the LLM. When
the user POST /ai/chatsubmits the request, the CAP service.jsruns the relevant code within it; it reads the product data, applies vector lookup and grounding, and then generates a response from the LLM.

 

After completing the service definition, we need to create the data model that will store the product data the application will use. This structure dbis defined in the CAP layer. Here, I defined an entity for the products and uploaded the initial data to the system via a CSV file.

In the data layer of the application, I defined three basic entities for inventory management and artificial intelligence operations:

namespace data;

entity Products {
  ID        : UUID @key;
  sku       : String(60) ;
  name      : String(200);
  price     : Decimal(15,2);
  currency  : String(3) default 'TRY';
  stock     : Integer default 0;
  category  : String(80);
  brand     : String(80);
  color     : String(40);
  barcode   : String(32);
  weight    : Decimal(10,3); 
  unit      : String(10) default 'adet';
  description: String(1000);
  createdAt : Timestamp default current_timestamp;
  updatedAt : Timestamp;
}

entity Embeddings {
  ID         : UUID @key;
  product    : Association to Products;
  chunkIndex : Integer;          
  text       : String(5000);    
  embedding  : LargeString;       
  model      : String(100);      
  dim        : Integer;       
  createdAt  : Timestamp default current_timestamp;
}

entity ProductVectors {
  sku       : String(60) @key;
  embedding : LargeString;
}

Productsâ€” Product Main Table

This table stores basic product information in the system.
Fields contain actual commercial parameters such as product name, price, and stock quantity.

Embeddingsâ€” Text Embedding Archive

This table is designed to store embeddings of product descriptions.
Embedding a product can be done by splitting it into multiple pieces of text, rather than as a single line.

ProductVectorsâ€” Fast Vector Lookup Table

This table holds a simplified version of the product SKU and embeddings.

For the project, I created a product dataset for testing purposes.
This CSV file contains basic product information used in the application's inventory query, embedding generation, and vector search processes.

We're using the CAP command to create the product and vector tables in the project deploy.
The following command takes the CDS data model and applies it to SQLite as a live database:

cds deploy --to sqlite:sqlite.db

 

 

 
 

Embedding Process and Data Preparation

The tables above form the data infrastructure of the application.
In the next step, the product text must be embedded and transferred to the vector index table.

This process takes place in two stages:

1 Converting product descriptions to embeddings 2 Loading
embeddings into the table for quick searchProductVectors

For this purpose, I added two helper scripts to the project:

 
/tools
 â”œâ”€ embed.js          
 â””â”€ init-vectors.js
 
These scripts are run once before the application runs and prepare the RAG infrastructure.

 

What is Embedding? 

Embedding is the process of converting text into a vector of numbers. In other words, it's a way of mathematically representing
text, words, or product descriptions .

try {
  require("dotenv").config();
} catch (e) {}
const cds = require("@sap/cds");
const { GoogleGenerativeAI } = require("@google/generative-ai");

async function embed(text) {
  const KEY = process.env.GEMINI_API_KEY;
  const genAI = new GoogleGenerativeAI(KEY);
  const model = genAI.getGenerativeModel({ model: "text-embedding-004" });
  const res = await model.embedContent(text);
  return res?.embedding?.values || [];
}

(async () => {
  const db = await cds.connect.to("db");
  const products = await db.run(`SELECT sku, name FROM data_Products`);
  for (const p of products) {
    const text = `${p.sku} ${p.name}`;
    const vec = await embed(text);
    await db.run(
      `INSERT OR REPLACE INTO data_ProductVectors (sku, embedding) VALUES (?, ?)`,
      [p.sku, JSON.stringify(vec)]
    );
    console.log("âœ“ embedded:", p.sku);
  }
  console.log(" Bitti");
  process.exit(0);
})();
// Note: To run this file, use the following in the terminal:
//    node tools/embed.js

To run the embedding script, use the following command in the terminal:

node tools/embed.js

When this command is run, product descriptions are converted to embeddings via the Gemini API and saved in the Embeddings table. This step is only performed when data is loaded or the product list changes.

 

Passing Embeddings to Vector Lookup Table (init-vectors.js):

Once the embeddings are created, we need to load this data into the SQLite vector table for fast vector search.

At this stage, I run the init-vectors.js script.

This script: Reads the Embeddings table Converts vectors to Float32 format.

Writes to the ProductVectors table. This makes it possible to search for cosine similarity / L2 distance on SQLite.

node tools/init-vectors.js

The embeddings and vector table are ready.
At this point, let's add the plugin to the project to enable vector similarity calculation in SQLite sqlite-vec:

sqlite-extensions/
 â””â”€ vec0.dll

This plugin adds the following functionality to SQLite:

  • vec_distance_cos() â€” Cosine similarity

  • vec_distance_l2() â€” L2 (Euclidean) distance

  • vec_version()â€” Version control

You can download it from the link below.

https://github.com/asg017/sqlite-vec/releases 

Here's how I install the plugin in Node.js:

const dll = path.resolve(__dirname, "..", "sqlite-extensions", "vec0.dll");
if (fs.existsSync(dll)) db.loadExtension(dll);
In this way the CAP service can work as an embedded vector database .

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Phase

To this point, we've prepared the application's data infrastructure, loaded the products into the system, converted them to embedding (numeric vector) format, and established a structure capable of vector searching on SQLite. Now, we're moving on to the real intelligence: the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) process.

The primary goal of the RAG approach is to prevent AI from relying solely on the model it was trained on and to enable it to produce more accurate, reliable, and contextual results by accessing real data. In this project, we implemented this as follows:

When a user types a stock-related query in natural language, the system first embeds the query and identifies the most relevant SKUs by performing a vector similarity search on SQLite-Vec. The actual records for these products are then retrieved from the SAP CAP database and provided as grounding for the Gemini model. This ensures that the AI â€‹â€‹generates its response based solely on existing product data, eliminating any hallucinations.

R â€” Retrieval (Finding information):

The query from the user ( ) queryis converted into an embedding and this embedding finds similar products using SQLite-Vec:

const qvec = await embed(query);
if (!qvec.length)
  return { error: "Embedding Ã¼retilemedi (Gemini).", products: [] };


const buf = toFloat32Buffer(qvec);
rows = db
  .prepare(`
    SELECT sku, vec_distance_cos(embedding, ?) AS dist
    FROM vec_product_vectors
    ORDER BY dist ASC
    LIMIT 5
  `)
  .all(buf);

In this phase, the system translates the user's natural language query into a numerical vector and returns the closest product placements based on vector similarity (cosine distance). In other words, this is where the "finding related information"
step occurs.

A â€” Augmentation (Adding contextual data)

Actual product records are pulled from the CAP database using the found SKUs :

const skus = rows.map((r) => r.sku);
const products = await cds.run`
  SELECT *
  FROM data.Products
  WHERE sku in ${skus}
`;

At this point:

  • Actual commercial data (product name, price, stock, category, etc.) are taken from the system.

  • The model is now prepared to produce answers with only this data.

In other words , the Retrieval result is strengthened with real information by being â€œAugmentedâ€ .

Generation (Answer generation)

The model generates an answer based solely on the above data with the grounding rule:

const prompt = `KullanÄ±cÄ±: "${query}"

ÃœrÃ¼n verileri (sadece bunlara dayan):
${lines}

Kurallar:
- Sadece yukarÄ±daki verilere dayan, uydurma bilgi verme.
- KÄ±sa ve net TÃ¼rkÃ§e cevap ver.
- EÄŸer kullanÄ±cÄ± spesifik SKU/Ã¼rÃ¼n sormamÄ±ÅŸsa, en yakÄ±n 1-3 uygun Ã¼rÃ¼nÃ¼ Ã¶zetle.
`;

const answer = await callGemini(prompt);
return { content: answer };

Here:

  • The model is fed only with real data .

  • Grounding is provided with the â€œdo not provide fabricated informationâ€ rule .

  • As a result, the model generates a reliable and context-based response.

RESULT:

With this project, we transformed a traditional inventory management application running on SAP CAP into an intelligent decision support system based on real data. Thanks to embedding, vector search, grounding, and Gemini integration, users can now search for products using natural language, and the model generates reliable and consistent answers based solely on existing corporate data. This approach provides a concrete example of how to improve processes with AI in businesses.

GÄ°THUB: https://github.com/furkanaksy838/Stock-asistan.git

å¦‚æœæ‚¨å¯¹BTPæ„Ÿå…´è¶£ï¼ŒBTPä¸ªäººç²¾é€‰å†…å®¹ç›®å½• | SAP Blogs å¯èƒ½æœ‰æ›´å¤šä½ éœ€è¦çš„å†…å®¹

 

æƒ³è±¡ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼šå½“å…¶ä»–å…¬å¸è¿˜åœ¨ä¸ºç³»ç»Ÿå‡çº§è€Œå¤´ç–¼ï¼Œæ•°å‘¨ç”šè‡³æ•°æœˆæµ‹è¯•è‡ªå®šä¹‰ä»£ç æ—¶ï¼Œä½ çš„ä¼ä¸šå´èƒ½åœ¨å‡ å¤©å†…å®ŒæˆSAPç³»ç»Ÿå‡çº§ï¼Œå¿«é€Ÿè·å¾—æœ€æ–°åŠŸèƒ½å’ŒAIèƒ½åŠ›ã€‚è¿™ä¸æ˜¯å¹»æƒ³ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯Clean Coreæ–¹æ³•å¸¦æ¥çš„ç°å®æ”¹å˜ã€‚

Clean Coreæ˜¯SAPæ¨å‡ºçš„ä¸€å¥—ç³»ç»Ÿæ¶æ„æ–¹æ³•è®ºï¼Œç»†åˆ†äº†äº”ä¸ªç»´åº¦çš„Clean, åˆ†åˆ«æ˜¯ä¸šåŠ¡æµç¨‹ï¼ŒåŠŸèƒ½æ‹“å±•ï¼Œæ•°æ®ï¼Œé›†æˆï¼Œè¿ç»´ã€‚

SAPä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¦æ¨å‡ºClean Coreï¼Ÿ

SAPå‘ç°ä¼ä¸šåœ¨å®šåˆ¶åŒ–SAPåº”ç”¨æ—¶ï¼Œå¦‚æœå¤§é‡åœ¨åº”ç”¨ä½“å†…åšä¿®æ”¹ï¼Œå°†é¢ä¸´è¯¸å¤šæŒ‘æˆ˜ï¼š

1.ä¼ä¸šè‡ªä¸»å¼€å‘æˆæœ¬ä¸Šå‡ï¼šå®šåˆ¶åŒ–ä»£ç è¶Šå¤šï¼Œè¿›ä¸€æ­¥å®šåˆ¶å¯¼è‡´çš„é£é™©ï¼Œå¼€å‘/æµ‹è¯•æˆæœ¬å°±ä¼šè¶Šé«˜

2.éš¾ä»¥å®æ–½ç³»ç»Ÿæ›´æ–°:æ ‡å‡†å‡çº§åŒ…å¯èƒ½ä¸å®šåˆ¶åŒ–ä»£ç ä¸å…¼å®¹

3.éš¾ä»¥å¼•å…¥åŸå‚å¼€å‘çš„æ–°åŠŸèƒ½ï¼šä¾‹å¦‚SAPçš„åµŒå…¥å¼AIåŠŸèƒ½

4.åº”ç”¨è‡ªå¼€å‘è¿‡å¤šå¯¼è‡´è¿è¡Œç¼“æ…¢

åŒæ—¶ï¼Œå¼€æºæŠ€æœ¯åœ¨ä¸€äº›åœºæ™¯ä¸‹å¯ä»¥æä¾›æ¯”ABAPæ›´å¥½çš„ä½“éªŒï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ç§»åŠ¨åº”ç”¨ï¼Œå·¥ä½œæµä¸RPAéœ€æ±‚ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥SAPé€‰æ‹©å¼•å…¥æ–°æŠ€æœ¯ï¼Œä¸ºSAPåº”ç”¨çš„å®šåˆ¶åŒ–æä¾›æ–°æ–¹å¼ï¼Œç»™åˆ°ç”¨æˆ·æ›´å¤šé€‰æ‹©ã€‚

 

ç”¨æˆ·å¦‚ä½•è¡¡é‡åº”ç”¨æ˜¯å¦ç¬¦åˆClean Coreæ ‡å‡†å‘¢ï¼Ÿ

ä¸€ä¸ªæœªç»ä¿®æ”¹çš„åº”ç”¨ï¼Œæ¸…æ´ç¨‹åº¦å°†ä¼šæ˜¯ç™¾åˆ†ä¹‹ç™¾ï¼Œè€Œå®æ–½è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­æ¯ä¸ªæ–°æ‹“å±•éƒ½å¯èƒ½å½±å“åˆ°æ¸…æ´ç¨‹åº¦ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ä¸€èˆ¬ä»å•ä¸ªæ‹“å±•çš„æ¸…æ´ç¨‹åº¦æ¥çœ‹è¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ã€‚

SAPé‡‡ç”¨A-Då››ä¸ªç­‰çº§æ¥è¡¡é‡å•ä¸ªæ‰©å±•çš„æ¸…æ´ç¨‹åº¦ï¼š

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud administration: Learn, practice, excel
entry.content:
Administering SAP Analytics Cloud effectively means mastering both the tools and the strategy behind them.

Join this exclusive session for SAP Partners â€” SAP Analytics Cloud administration: Learn, practice, excel â€” and strengthen your expertise in managing, securing, and optimizing SAP BTP landscapes.

Weâ€™ll cover real-world scenarios, troubleshooting tips, and best practices for user management, content security, data protection, authentication, and monitoring.

Plus, experience a live â€œshow and tellâ€ segment with guided demonstrations â€” and get inspired to pursue your SAP Certified Associate â€“ SAP BTP Administrator path.

entry.title: SAP Document AI accelerates document-centric business processes with Generative AI
entry.content:
Authors: @amagnani37 & @merza 

Thank you to everyone who joined our recent partner webinar, "Streamline document processing with SAP Document AI". This session was part of our ongoing partner webinar series, "Talk to your business with Generative AI", and the turnout and engagement were fantastic.

For those who couldn't make it, or for anyone who wants a recap, weâ€”Merza Klaghstan, Alice Magnani, and Jacob Tan from the BTP & AI Solution Architects team â€”wanted to share the key takeaways, demos, and technical insights from the session.

Our goal was to go beyond a simple feature list and show you how SAP Document AI can be the centerpiece of a complete, end-to-end business solution.

Hereâ€™s what we covered.

Part 1: What is SAP Document AI and Why Does it Matter?

We kicked off by tackling the core business problem: a staggering 70-80% of all enterprise information is unstructured. Manually processing this data from documents, emails, and scans is not only slow but also expensive and prone to errors.

SAP Document AI, formerly known as Document Information Extraction (DOX), is SAP's AI-powered solution on the Business Technology Platform (BTP) designed to solve this. It goes far beyond simple Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to extract, classify, and validate data with high precision.

Key Capabilities

We highlighted several key features:

  • Multiple Editions: The service is available in Base AI, Premium AI (which includes Generative AI capabilities), and Embedded editions to fit different use cases. We also want to highlight for our SAP Partners that the Premium AI edition is part of the Test, Demo, and Development (TDD) license, which provides a much more convenient model for your non-productive and internal development purposes.

     

  • The New "Workspace" UI: We compared the classic "Basic" UI with the new, full-featured "Workspace," which is the future of the service and includes capabilities like email channel configuration and workflow management.

    It's the new, full-featured environment for all document processing tasks . We want to emphasize that from now on, all the latest SAP Document AI features will be available in the Workspace UI only, so we strongly advise using it for all new projects.

     

  • Pre-Configured & Custom Content (Schemas): The service provides many pre-trained models (called "Schemas") for standard documents like invoices and purchase orders. The real power, however, comes from creating custom schemas for any document type your business needsâ€”from specialized licenses to internal forms.

     

  • Generative AI & Instant Learning: For custom schemas, SAP Document AI leverages Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) to understand and extract information. We also demonstrated "Instant Learning," where the model learns from your manual corrections immediately. After one correction, it knows how to handle that document layout correctly the next time.

    In our demo, we showed how the model initially struggled with a name containing a middle name and extracted the wrong federation name (full name vs. acronym) . After one manual correction and confirmation, it learned immediately. Technically, this feature uses few-shots prompting to make the underlying LLM aware of your previously reviewed documents to improve accuracy on the next run.

Part 2: A Real-World Use Case: "Vertigo Travels"

To make this real, we introduced "Vertigo Travels," a fictional travel agency specializing in sports and adventure holidays. Their key challenge is managing the various kind of documents required for subscriptions, such as ID cards, medical certificates, and diving licenses.

The solution architecture includes:

  1. The Vertigo Travels website, a frontend application,  deployed in Cloud Foundry, serving as entry point for Travelers to select travel packages and upload the necessary documents, such as ID cards or medical certificates. The backend logic is a CAP (Node.js) application also deployed in a cloud Foundry.

  2. SAP Document AI, for all document intelligence operations, communicating via API with our backend application.

  3. SAP HANA Cloud, as a persistence layer for our application, to store all the entities involved in the subscription process.

  4. SAP Build Work Zone standard edition, as the entry point for Vertigo Travels employees to supervise the process. From Work Zone, business users can access the Vertigo Travel website for admin operations, or the SAP Document AI workspace, for instance to review documents. SAP Build Work Zone also allows business users to use SAP Document AI via mobile.

  5. SAP Build Process Automation, to define business rules to automate some document validation checks. Although this could also be implemented as part of the  Vertigo Travels backend application, SAP Build Process Automation enables citizen developers to modify easily the business logics when required.

  6. SAP S/4HANA Cloud, as the core SAP Cloud solution. The Vertigo Travels backend is integrated with modules such as Business Partners, Products, Sales Orders/Invoice, Customer Return for refund.

For the source code, you may refer here for reference.

P.S. if you're planning to work on this prototype, please give us a shout out~! So at least we know somebody is trying our repository out!

We demonstrated three end-to-end scenarios:

  1. The E2E Flow: A traveler, Mary, subscribes on the website and uploads her documents. A back-office employee, Barry, reviews and corrects one document in the Document AI Workspace. Once confirmed, a Sales Order is automatically created in S/4HANA Cloud.

  2. Multi-Channel Ingestion: A traveler, Luca, visits an office. The employee uses SAP Mobile Start to scan his ID and medical certificate. The system then automatically emails Luca about a missing document. He simply replies to the email with his license attached, which is automatically ingested via the Inbound Channel feature.

  3. Automation: A traveler, Claire, uploads an income statement to apply for a discount. SAP Build Process Automation runs a rule to check her eligibility. When she submits her final documents, they have a high confidence score and are auto-confirmed without any manual review.

Part 3: How We Built It (The Technical Deep Dive)

For our developer community, we walked through the "how-to" for the key components.

For the source code, you may refer here for reference.

P.S. if you're planning to work on this prototype, please give us a shout out~! So at least we know somebody is trying our repository out!

1. Setup and Schema Management: We started with the BTP setup, which involves managing entitlements, creating the service instance, and, critically, establishing trust with SAP Cloud Identity Service (IAS) for user authorization. We then showed how to create the custom schemas that power the application.

When you set up your entitlements, make sure to use the application subscription ending in -ias (Identity Authentication Service), as this is the one that provisions the new Workspace interface.

2. API-Driven Development: Our CAP application's backend communicates directly with Document AI's APIs. We showed code snippets for uploading a file (using the FileService) and processing it against a schema (using the SchemaService).

How to retrieve specific extracted values:
While our demo UI showed a simple text extraction, your application will likely need specific, structured data (like "gross_family_income" or "number_of_kids"). The API makes this straightforward:

    • After processing the document, you get a Document ID.
    • You can use this Document ID to retrieve the Document Version ID.
    • Using the Version ID, you can then query the Entities for that document. 4. Finally, you can retrieve the specific value by using the Entity ID (e.g., the ID for your "number_of_kids" field) .

This is how our automation process, for example, was able to pull only the family income and number of kids to pass to the rules engine.

3. Configuring Email Ingestion: We configured the "Channels" feature to monitor an email inbox. This required registering an app in Microsoft Azure, granting Mail.ReadWrite permissions , and then using the Document AI Workspace to map a specific email folder to our target schema.

4. Enabling SAP Mobile Start: This was a key integration for the in-office scenario. It involved three steps:

    • Adding the Document AI dependency to SAP Build Work Zone within the IAS console.
    • Creating a specific BTP destination (sapdocumentaimobilestartintegration).
    • Configuring the app tile in the Work Zone Site Manager with the correct navigation and visualization parameters (e.g., mobilestart.type = documentAi).

4. Automating Logic with SAP Build Process Automation: To keep our application logic flexible, we externalized our validation rules. We created a process in SAP Build Process Automation with a Decision Table (Rule) to calculate the family discount based on income and number of kids. This process is exposed as an API and triggered by our CAP application.

For the source code, you may refer here for reference.

P.S. if you're planning to work on this prototype, please give us a shout out~! So at least we know somebody is trying our repository out!

Part 4: Conclusion, Best Practices, and What's Next

We concluded with some key advice and a look ahead.

Best Practices & Responsible AI

  • Quality In, Quality Out: The accuracy of extraction heavily depends on the quality of your scans.
  • Human in the Loop: While automation is powerful, always design your processes with a "human in the loop" for validation, especially for critical data.
  • Responsible AI: We reiterated SAP's commitment to AI ethics. External LLM providers are carefully selected and are not permitted to store or retrain their models on customer data. Features like continuous data sharing for model improvement are strictly opt-in and should not be used for sensitive personal data.

Get Started and Look Ahead

We are committed to helping our partners build on this platform. Here are the resources to get you started:

  • SAP Document AI Official Help Page: https://url.sap/imohkv
  • Vertigo Travels GitHub Repository: https://url.sap/pi5vwn (The code for our demo app will be available here!)
  • SAP Community for AI/ML: https://url.sap/ai-ml-grp

The roadmap for SAP Document AI is packed with features, including more pre-built schemas, document workflows, custom LLM prompting, and deeper integration with Joule.

Finally, don't miss SAP TechEd Virtual! Be sure to check out sessions AI821v and AI102v for the latest roadmap and deep-dive innovations from the product team.

Please feel free to leave any questions or feedback in the comments below!

entry.content:
Learn how to run impactful SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) Discovery Workshops that turn customer conversations into data-driven action plans.

In this 60-minute enablement session for SAP Partners (presales consultants, enterprise architects, and data architects), youâ€™ll discover how to:
 âœ… Engage customers on data & analytics using the BDC Discovery framework
 âœ… Identify challenges, prioritize use cases, and define architecture recommendations
 âœ… Reuse SAPâ€™s free partner assets â€” master deck, questionnaire, demo scripts, and more â€” to accelerate customer adoption and pipeline creation

Youâ€™ll also learn how to deliver the four-step journey with SAP â€” from preparation to review â€” and align with focus topics such as Data Strategy, RISE Transformation, BW Journey, Analytics Everywhere, and Business Data for AI.

ğŸ‘‰ Register now to master the SPA BDC Discovery Workshop framework and empower your customer engagements.  https://partneredge.sap.com/en/library/education/psd/2025/nov/e_oe_te_w_PSD_WEB_00012058.html

entry.title: 2H 2025 Release Highlights: New innovations in SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding
entry.content:
With the 2H 2025 release, we have delivered new capabilities within SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding to improve how organizations attract and hire the best talent.  

Through customer influence on the Customer Community and innovative product enhancements, we are bringing your ideas to life and driving improvements across the recruiting experience.

To learn more watch the on-demand Q&A webinars: 2H 2025 Product Release Webinars and Recruiting & Onboarding 2H 2025 Customer Release Q&A. To hear more about the roadmap and broader view of our strategy, watch the VIP Virtual Program for Strategic Roadmap Updates.    

All of the 2H 2025 release items can be found on the Whatâ€™s New Viewer. These new features will be live in Production on November 16th, 2025.

This release brings enhanced AI-driven capabilities to the SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding solution, enabling hiring teams to streamline key onboarding activities, improve offboarding, and accelerate hiring.

Auto-completion of new hire activities

With auto-completion of new hire activities, administrators can now automate routine onboarding tasks, administrators can now automate routine onboarding tasks, like preparing for day one and writing welcome messages. This saves time in high-volume and bulk hiring scenarios, ensures consistency, and lets hiring managers and new hires focus on a successful start.

AI-assisted document processing

AI-assisted document processing further enhances onboarding by automatically extracting information from IDs and passports to support employee verification, ensuring compliance while reducing manual input.

Redesigned offboarding dashboard

The redesigned offboarding dashboard provides a clear, unified view for HR and hiring manager to track progress, minimize delays, and deliver a smooth transition from employee to alumni.

SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) for Onboarding

A new embedded extensibility wizard feature from SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) is now available within Onboarding. This powerful tool guides users through creating custom application extensions, such as adding unique data fields or tailoring business processes. By simplifying customization, the extensibility wizard helps customers quickly add the fields and workflows they need to reduce time spent on manual updates and make it easier to complete tasks accurately.

Continuously Delivering Enhancements     

With every release, we are excited to deliver these new innovations and continue our journey of providing even greater value to our customers. For full details, please check out the 2H 2025 Release Highlights Resources: 

  • 2H 2025 Release Highlights Brochure
  • 2H 2025 Release Highlights Video 
  • 2H 2025 Release Highlights News Article  
  • Product Release & Road Map Information

Learn more about SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding.

entry.title: New Kyma Telemetry Docs: Simplified, Task-Oriented, and User-First
entry.content:
We're happy to announce the release of the completely restructured and rewritten documentation for the Kyma Telemetry module! We've moved from a component-centric view to a user-first, task-oriented structure, all centered around a new, unified Telemetry Pipeline API.

 

What's New for Our Users?

  • The Unified Telemetry Pipeline API â€“ At the heart of the new structure is the Telemetry Pipeline API. With the introduction of OTLP-based LogPipelines, you can now use a consistent set of CRDs to configure all your telemetry signals, which reduces complexity and makes your setup easier to maintain.

  • A Clearer, Task-Based Structure â€“ Find what you need faster with new top-level guides for Collecting Logs, Collecting Traces, and Collecting Metrics. Each guide walks you through the process for a specific signal, from minimal setup to advanced configuration

  • A Clear Migration Path â€“ If you're still using the legacy Fluent Bit (HTTP) log output, read Migrate Your LogPipeline From HTTP to OTLP, which guides you step-by-step to switch to the new OTLP setup without data loss.

The 'Why' Behind the Change: A Look at the Craft

If you're a fellow tech writer or just curious about the why, this wasn't just a rewrite; it was a fundamental shift in our information architecture:

Our previous documentation was component-centric. It described each component (Telemetry Manager, gateways, agents, pipelines...) and its internal architecture, explaining "What does the component do?". Based on that, the reader had to figure out how to accomplish a task.

Our new approach is goal-oriented, built on principles from the DITA (Darwin Information Typing Architecture) and industry best practices. Our guiding question is "What is the user trying to achieve?" This led us to structure the content as self-contained pages, each focusing on a user goal. For readers interested in the nitty-gritty details - you still find all of those in the consolidated Architecture docs.

Why This Matters

This new structure makes it easier to see what's common and what's different for the Telemetry pipeline types. Furthermore, we've re-centered the documentation on the actions you need to perform:

  • Start with your goal: Task-oriented titles such as Monitor Pipeline Health help you find what you need without knowing our internal component names.
  • Progressive disclosure of information: Get started with a minimal configuration quickly, and then explore advanced operations like filtering or processing only when you need them.
  • Get straight to the point: With consolidated troubleshooting instructions on the top level, you can start start fixing issues immediately without reading through unrelated details.

Get Started Today

We invite you to dive into the new Telemetry module documentation. We're proud of this new structure and believe it's a clear step up for clarity and usability.

Your Feedback Matters

Whether you're a user of the module or a fellow writer, we'd love to hear your thoughts. Give us feedback directly on the SAP Help Portal pages. Your input is crucial as we continue to evolve our content.

entry.title: Join SAP Usability Testing Sessions at SAP TechEd Bangalore - Influence your Product Experience
entry.content:
Join our live usability testing session at SAP TechEd Bangalore on November 25-26, 2025.

Usability testing offers a unique opportunity for SAP users to engage directly with the SAP product and development teams. In a focused 60-minute one-on-one session, youâ€™ll interact with product screens and evaluate whether the buttons, terminology, and features meet your expectations and workflow needs

If you've ever thought, "Why canâ€™t I just click here and make it work?" â€” this is your chance to influence exactly that. Your feedback helps us create intuitive, user-friendly solutions that better support your business.

Prerequisites for participating in usability testing at SAP TechEd Bangalore

  1. To be able to participate, you need to be an attendee at SAP TechEd Bangalore.
  2. You need to have experience with using the product for which youâ€™d like to participate in a Usability Test.

What you need to know about the registration process

  1. We use the Bookings app to manage registrations for Usability Tests at SAP TechEd. Your data will be stored in our forms on the booking platform. To the extent that the entered information is personal data, SAP will use it in accordance with this privacy statement.
  2. Use the links below to register for the Usability Test Stations at SAP TechEd Bangalore and pick one of the available time slots for the test session.
    Please arrive at the Usability Test Lab 10 minutes before your scheduled time.
  3. Please sign up with your business email address â€“ it will only be used for scheduling your test session; you will not receive marketing because of this registration.
  4. Email notifications will be sent from Usability Testing Lab Participant Interest Form <UsabilityTestingLabRegistration@sap.onmicrosoft.com>  Please check your SPAM/JUNK folder in case you do not receive the confirmation emails.
  5. Interested in future online user research opportunities after SAP TechEd?
    To receive invitations, please complete the registration form for the SAP User Research Panel.
    If you donâ€™t sign up, your contact information will be deleted four weeks after the event in accordance with our data privacy policy.

Usability Test Stations

Usability Test Station 1: 
Integration Flow generation using AI & Groovy scripts readiness for Integration Cell runtime


Test the AI feature for creating integration flows from scenario descriptions (including Groovy script steps) with error handling. Evaluate Groovy script readiness for the upcoming Integration Cell runtime and explore integration flow creation via Joule using high-fidelity prototypes.

Target audience: Participation in this usability test is restricted to users of SAP Integration Suite who have experience with developing integration flows.

Potential roles include:

  • Integration Developers
  • Solution Architects,
  • SAP BTP Consultants
  • Business Process Experts 

Register here as a tester

 

Usability Test Station 2: 
Test Conditional Task Chains and Port Connections in SAP Datasphere, BDC

Weâ€™re inviting experienced SAP Datasphere Modelers and Integrators to participate in a usability testing session for the enhanced Task Chain workflow.

This session focuses on evaluating the new ability to react to task outcomes and define conditional execution paths using dedicated ports:

  • Success (green)
  • Error (red)
  • Any (blue)

These enhancements aim to give users greater control and flexibility in orchestrating complex workflows. Alongside these, participants will also explore other new capabilities introduced to improve error handling and configurability.

A key focus of this session is to assess both usability and the durability of interactions â€” ensuring that the experience remains stable, intuitive, and efficient across varied use cases.

Your feedback will help us refine and improve our workflows even further.

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • SAP Datasphere Modeler / Integrator
  • Consultants
  • Developers

Register here as a tester


Usability Test Station 3: 
End-to-End Agentic User Journey for Building Processes with Joule

In this session, participants will experience and evaluate a future-state, agentic user journey for building business processes using Joule, the AI assistant integrated within SAP Build Process Automation. The focus is on exploring how Joule can support users through end-to-end process creation by providing intelligent suggestions, automating repetitive steps, and enabling seamless collaboration with key stakeholders. We aim to understand usability, clarity of guidance, efficiency gains, and how well Joule integrates into existing SAP Build Process Automation workflows. Participant feedback will help refine the interaction model and identify opportunities for enhancing agentic assistance in real scenarios. 

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Regular SAP Build Process Automation users
  • Process Designers
  • Citizen Developers
  • Automation Leads
  • Consultants
  • Business Process Experts

Register here as a tester

Usability Test Station 4: 
Smart Helper - An agent you define; actions you approve; Easy Fill: Copy, Paste, and Done in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

This session aims to evaluate the user experience and effectiveness of two AI-powered capabilities: Smart helper- we will evaluate how easy it is to get started, how clear control and approvals feel, and how overall usability and user experience are perceived; Easy Fill - we will evaluate how easy it is to use and if there is something missing. 

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Business Process Experts
  • Solution Architects
  • IT Administrators
  • SAP S/4HANA Solution Consultants
  • Developers

Register here as a tester


Usability Test Station 5: 
Evaluate WalkMe Onboarding Experience on SAP SuccessFactors

Evaluate how users access WalkMe tours and engage with the onboarding experience for SuccessFactors features. To evaluate how effectively users can complete key SAP SuccessFactors tasks using WalkMe tours by identifying any usability, clarity, or content issues and gathering feedback to improve the overall experience.

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Business Process Experts
  • Solution Architects
  • IT Administrators
  • SAP SuccessFactors Solution Consultants

Register here as a tester

Usability Test Station 6: 
Supercharge your SAP Fiori elements app development with SAP Fiori tools and AI

SAP Fiori tools are evolving to allow companies to dramatically improve developer efficiency by integrating intelligent, AI-enabled features and editors into the development environment. SAP Fiori tools are designed to lower the entry barrier for new teams while providing the advanced capabilities and flexibility that experienced developers demand. In this usability session, you can experiment with some of our early AI-driven features, provide feedback on our tools and our vision, and directly influence our direction for the next generation of intelligent development tools.

Target audience:
Participation in this usability test is restricted to users with experience developing Fiori apps using SAP Fiori tools (which are a part of SAP Build Code). Potential roles include:

  • S/4HANA Developers
  • Web Developers
  • Fiori Developers
  • Fiori Elements Developers
  • SAP Developers
  • Product Owners
  • Users of the Annotation Modeler
  • Other front-end developers leveraging web technologies

Register here as a tester


Disclaimer (for SAP TechEd 2025, Bangalore usability testing interest list)
By registering you are expressing interest to join the participant list for usability testing at SAP TechEd 2025, Bangalore. Registration does not guarantee participation. Selected participants will be notified separately by email once they meet all eligibility criteria required to take part in the sessions and provide feedback. Due to limited seats, we cannot accommodate all registrants; priority will be given to applicants who meet specific selection criteria (for example: product experience, implementation involvement, end-user knowledge, valid licensing status, and other program requirements).

entry.title: Beyond REST: Exploring GraphQL API Integration in SAP BTP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Introduction

GraphQL is transforming the way modern applications connect to and consume enterprise data, offering efficient and flexible querying  developers and integration designers. In SAP landscapes, this means you can consolidate complex integration flows and reduce payload size.

This article introduces GraphQL basics and demonstrates how to integrate SAP Cloud Integration with GraphQL APIs, delivering practical and step-by-step hands on you can apply to your own integration scenarios.

Recently I had an opportunity to work on an integration project where the customer extensively leveraged GraphQL APIs. That's where I thought sharing my experience will be helpful for developers to help in their GraphQL integration journey.

 

What is GraphQL?

Before we dive into actual integration flow, let us first try to understand some basics of GraphQL.

GraphQL is a query language for APIs that executes queries against a defined and a strongly-typed schema. Unlike traditional REST APIs that expose multiple endpoints for specific data objects, GraphQL APIs provide a single endpoint where clients can request exactly the fields they need, avoiding both over-fetching and under-fetching of data.

It is a schema based approach that gives the consumers of the APIs more control over the data retrieval at the same time making integrations more flexible, particularly in complex enterprise landscapes.

Before jumping on the GraphQL integration, first take a look at a sample GraphQL API (which I have also used in my demo)

Countries API: Explore country details such as languages, capitals, and regions.

  • Endpoint: https://countries.trevorblades.com/

  • Example Query 1: Fetch all countries.
query {
  countries {
    code
    name
    capital
    continent {
      name
    }
    languages {
      name
    }
  }
}
â€‹
  • Example Query 2: Fetch country with code
query {
  country(code:"US") {
    code
    name
    capital
    continent {
      name
    }
    languages {
      name
    }
  }
}

In the above two examples, if you see the API endpoint remains same but the query changes based on the desired response. You can add or remove attributes from the query section.

Try out by yourself and you will understand the basics quickly.

 

The Core Challenges

Unlike OData or SOAP, there isnâ€™t a native GraphQL adapter available in SAP BTP Cloud Integration. This means you canâ€™t directly select a â€œGraphQLâ€ protocol from the standard adapter list when configuring your integration flows. 

Good News: We can leverage standard HTTP adapter for this type of integration.

You must also set appropriate HTTP headers (such as Content-Type, authentication/tokens etc.). Parsing the flexible GraphQL responses often involves extra effort during mapping or transformation compared to protocol-specific adapters.

Another challenge is that as GraphQL provides flexible schema, there is often no OpenAPI or Swagger specifications available for these APIs. This makes integration highly adaptable but developers have to rely on documentation instead of OpenAPI contract like YAML file. Which means you may not be able to directly use standard message mappings directly.

Good News: We can leverage converters (JSON to XML) and groovy scripting extensively to handle transformations and message processing.

 

Real World Use Case

I tackled a real-world scenario which I will explain briefly. The use case centered around synchronizing stock levels between an e-commerce platform and SAP S/4HANA.

  • Whenever the e-commerce marketplace detects an order change, it sends a notification event to the integration flow.

  • The flow receives this event and extracts the order code from the notification event.

  • Using this order code, the flow triggers a GraphQL API call to fetch up-to-date order details for that order code from the customer e-commerce platform.

  • The retrieved order information is then mapped to the corresponding SAP S/4HANA object, enabling an accurate and timely order data integrity within the ERP system.

This integration ensures both systems remain aligned and allows real-time order data synchronization based on event-based design.

To simulate this integration, I used a similar workflow, but using the countries GraphQL API to explain the integration.

 

Integration Flow Walkthrough

In this section, I will walk you through the integration flow (iFlow) to connect SAP BTP Cloud Integration with a GraphQL API. Below is a screenshot of the iFlow design, highlighting the main components involved in orchestrating the request and handling the response.

Figure-1: Integration Flow

We will break down main steps to understand:

  1. How the flow is structured
  2. How the HTTP adapter is configured
  3. How message processing and data mapping are managed for GraphQL integration
  • Groovy Scripting: Groovy gives control for creating GraphQL request. Here is a sample groovy script which I have used
import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import groovy.json.JsonSlurper;
import groovy.json.JsonBuilder;

def Message processData(Message message) 
{
	def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String) as String;
	def jsonInput = new JsonSlurper().parseText(body);

	if(!jsonInput) {
		throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input payload is empty or null");
	}
	
	def countryCode = (jsonInput.countryCode != null) ? jsonInput.countryCode : "IN";

	def graphQLQuery = """query {
  		country(code: "${countryCode}") {
  		  name
  		  native
  		  capital
  		  currency
  		  languages {
  		    name
  		  }
  		}
	}""";
	
	// Convert the GraphQL query into a JSON payload and set it as message body
    def jsonBody = new JsonBuilder([query: graphQLQuery]).toString()
    message.setBody(jsonBody)
	message.setHeader("Content-Type", "application/json");

	//log message body
	def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message);
	if(messageLog != null) {
		messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("GraphQL Request Body", jsonBody, "text/plain");
	}

	return message;
}â€‹

  • HTTP Adapter: Use standard HTTP adapter to provide GraphQL API endpoint, authentication, additional headers etc. In this POC, I have skipped the authentication piece as our main focus is GraphQL API integration.

  • JSON to XML Converter: After getting the JSON response, leverage the JSON to XML converter to get the XML payload.

  • Message Mapping: Once you get the sample XML, generate an XSD using XSD generator tools. This XSD can be used as a source XSD in the message mapping component. The target XSD is the one which you can get the the target API schema (Either SOAP Or OData) 

I have provided the integration flows in my GitHub

Take time to download the package, deploy it in your tenant and give it a try.

 

Mutations

In the above integration flow, I have only shown how to get the data using GraphQL APIs. But in real world you might also be required to create or update data. The countries GraphQL API is READ ONLY but I will explain theoretically how we can accomplish it in a groovy which you can use it as reference (provided your API supports it).

Suppose I want to update capital name of any country.

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import groovy.json.JsonSlurper;
import groovy.json.JsonBuilder;

def String getGraphQLQuery() {
    return '''
    mutation UpdateCountryCapital($input: UpdateCountryInput!) {
      updateCountryCapital(input: $input) {
        code
        name
        capital
      }
    }
    '''
}

def Message processData(Message message) 
{
    def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String) as String
    def inputJson = new JsonSlurper().parseText(body)
    if (!inputJson) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input payload is empty or null");
    }
    // Compose the input for GraphQL variables
    def inputMap = [
        code: inputJson.code,
        capital: inputJson.capital
    ]

    // Build the GraphQL mutation payload
    def graphQLBody = [
        query: getGraphQLQuery(),
        variables: [input: inputMap]
    ]
    def jsonBody = new JsonBuilder(graphQLBody).toString()
    message.setBody(jsonBody)
    message.setHeader("Content-Type", "application/json");

    // Optional: log message body
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message);
    if(messageLog != null) {
        messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("GraphQL Request Body", jsonBody, "text/plain");
    }

    return message;
}

Note: Above groovy is an example to showcase how to build CREATE/UPDATE request for GraphQL API. 

 

Conclusion

Integrating GraphQL APIs with SAP BTP Cloud Integration opens up flexible, dynamic data exchange between external applications and your SAP landscape even without a native GraphQL adapter.

By leveraging the HTTP adapter, Groovy scripting and powerful message processing tools like JSON-to-XML conversion and custom mappings, you can successfully bridge the gap.

While GraphQLâ€™s adaptable schema presents unique integration challenges, it also enables precise and efficient data retrieval. With a clear understanding of the core concepts, tools and practical steps covered in this walkthrough, you are ready to design robust solutions for similar event-driven scenarios in your own enterprise.

Disclaimer: This is not an official reference application or documentation. The thoughts outlined in this blog are based on my real world experience and learnings.

Feel free to â€œlikeâ€œ, â€œShareâ€œ, â€œAdd a Commentâ€ and to get more updates about my next blogs follow me!

 

References

  1. Official GraphQL Documentation
  2. SAP Cloud Integration Documentation (Help Portal)

entry.title: From Exploration to Excellence: The Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

You've made the investment in SAP Business Technology Platform. You've implemented integrations, built extensions, and connected your enterprise landscape. But here's the question that keeps IT leaders up at night: Are you truly maximizing SAP BTP's potential, or are you leaving transformative value on the table?

For most organizations, the honest answer is somewhere in betweenâ€”and that uncertainty is precisely the problem. Without a clear baseline of your current capabilities, it's nearly impossible to chart an effective course forward or justify additional resources to stakeholders who demand measurable results.

To tackle this challenge, SAP introduced the Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP at SAP TechEd 2025â€”a comprehensive technical evaluation designed to transform uncertainty into actionable insights. If you missed it during SAP TechEd, here are all the exciting details. Here's the On-Demand session of the SAP TechEd 2025 XP100v | Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence.

 

What You'll Get: Immediate Value, Strategic Direction

You'll gain a precise understanding of your organization's maturity of SAP BTP utilization, allowing you to identify and address areas for improvement with tailored recommendations. Additionally, you'll align your platform strategy with broader business objectives, ensuring that every effort contributes to your digital transformation goals. Moreover, you'll uncover hidden operational efficiencies and innovative solutions that can drive tangible business value, elevating your role as a strategic tech leader within the organization.

  • Roadmap Clarity: Transform vague improvement intentions into a structured roadmap with prioritized actions based on your specific needs.
  • Investment Justification: Develop compelling business cases for additional SAP BTP investments, armed with concrete data on maturity levels and improvement opportunities, aligned with your overall business objectives.
  • Operational Efficiency: Uncover potential inefficiencies in how you're consuming SAP BTP services and discover opportunities to optimize SAP BTP utilization.
  • Innovation Acceleration: Identify new use cases and innovative solutions you haven't considered based on your maturity profile.

 

Getting Started: The Assessment Process

The online questionnaire takes only 10-15 minutes to complete, which is less time than your daily stand-up. No lengthy interviews or extensive documentation reviewsâ€”just focused questions that get to the heart of your implementation. Upon completion, you receive immediate scoring along with a comprehensive report.

  1. Complete the Questionnaire: Answer focused questions across five key dimensions in just 10-15 minutes.
  2. Receive Your Results: Get immediate feedback and access your comprehensive report in PDF to find areas for improvement and instant recommendations.
  3. Take Action: Use the tailored recommendations to act.

 

 

 

Maturity Levels Explained

The Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP is designed to provide organizations with a clear, current snapshot of how to utilize SAP BTP effectively. This snapshot is segmented into five distinct maturity levels, each representing different stages of adoption and integration within the organization. These levels serve as indicators of an organization's ongoing journey towards digital transformation and innovation. By understanding and leveraging these levels, organizations can strategically evolve their usage of SAP BTP, ensuring that they derive maximum value from the platform.

1. Getting Started: This initial phase involves early exploration of the platform, where learning and testing ideas occur in an ad hoc manner. Organizations at this level are in the discovery phase, familiarizing themselves with the platform's capabilities and potential.

2. Adoption: In this stage, foundations begin to form as growing platform adoption occurs, although key practices are still maturing. Organizations start to incorporate SAP BTP more consistently into their operations, paving the way for broader implementation.

3. Standardization: At this level, clear processes and shared approaches are established across teams, ensuring consistent and strategic SAP BTP usage. This marks a critical point where the platform becomes an integral part of the organization's technology stack, contributing to more streamlined and effective operations.

4. Scalable Execution: Here, SAP BTP is deployed reliably at scale, driving innovation across the organization. This stage reflects a higher level of maturity, where the platform is not only used but also leveraged to achieve strategic business objectives.

5. Center of Excellence: The pinnacle of SAP BTP maturity, this level signifies that the organization recognizes SAP BTP as a strategic driver of its business. Enterprise architecture, operations, and delivery capabilities are optimized around SAP BTP, fostering an environment of continuous innovation.

The Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP serves as a valuable tool for organizations to evaluate their current standing and plan for future growth. It not only aids in identifying areas for improvement but also provides actionable insights to enhance the platform's utilization, ultimately supporting the organization's continuous process of evolution and thriving in the digital landscape.

 

Why Act Now

The role of SAP Business Technology Platform in driving intelligent enterprises continues to expand, with new capabilities emerging regularlyâ€”from enhanced integration patterns to advanced AI agents.

Organizations with a clear understanding of their current maturity level can evaluate these innovations strategically, adopting what drives value while avoiding distraction. The objective is not only to assess your BTP maturity but also to create a continuous improvement cycle rather than being forced to react when gaps become critical.

In conjunction with the new Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP,  SAP BTP Adoption Phases are introduced on SAP BTP Guidance Framework as a beta version for SAP TechEd. This will provide a clear path to align the phases of SAP BTP adoption with SAP Activate Methodology. SAP Activate Methodology also offers additional common accelerators (e.g., project management templates) and an integrated tool chain (e.g. with SAP Cloud ALM) to run larger SAP implementation projects.

To illustrate the relationship between the Future Ready Enterprise Model, the new Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP, and the Adoption Phases, hereâ€™s a TAM of the process:

 

Your Next Steps: From Assessment to Action

Bharat Sandhu, CMO of SAP BTP, notes that developers struggle to effectively utilize AI due to difficulties in integrating it with business-specific data and processes, resulting in diminished benefits. Additionally, the time and cost of building applications, along with the challenge of managing fragmented systems, underscore the need for a more robust AI-powered development platform. To solve those challenges, knowing precisely where your organization stands today is crucial for maximizing the transformative potential of SAP BTP. The Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP is designed to deliver this insight, helping you determine if your organization is fully harnessing its capabilities.

Whether you're at the beginning of your SAP BTP journey or looking to optimize mature investments, this assessment provides a comprehensive technical baseline alongside the strategic clarity, objective data, and actionable recommendations you need to move forward with confidence.

Watch the SAP TechEd On-Demand Session: Watch the On-Demand session XP100v | Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence for a demo of the Maturity Assessment for SAP BTP.

Engage with the Community: Join upcoming webinars and workshops where SAP experts and peers discuss assessment findings and share best practices for advancing BTP maturity.

Leverage Additional Resources: Explore the existing SAP BTP use cases and the corresponding SAP Discovery Center missions with accelerators.

Read about SAP Discovery Center Updates: Read this blog to learn all of the notable updates on SAP Discovery Center in preparation for SAP TechEd 2025. 

 

Take the first step by visiting SAP Discovery Center today and unlock the insights that will drive your next breakthroughğŸš€
